channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6336] AssertionFailedError in testStalePlansOnLargeTable(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.StalePlansTest)
item.description:
Saw this in nightly testing of trunk (10.11 alpha at revision 1520189):
testStalePlansOnLargeTable(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.StalePlansTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.StalePlansTest.testStalePlansOnLargeTable(StalePlansTest.java:252)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:76)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.runBare(BaseTestCase.java:117)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBareOverridable(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:439)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBare(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:456)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: This appears different from DERBY-2949 / DERBY-3284.

I saw another instance of this failure against 10.10.2.1 (1584503), Windows 2008 (on vmware) with jdk 1.8 (b132).

1) testStalePlansOnLargeTable(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.StalePlansTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.StalePlansTest.testStalePlansOnLargeTable(StalePlansTest.java:252)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.runBare(BaseTestCase.java:118)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBareOverridable(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:442)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBare(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:459)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)

derby.log in the fail directory does not reflect any of the expected errors from negative test cases, for instance we expect a ERROR XCY00: Invalid value for property 'derby.language.stalePlanCheckInterval'='2'.
Instead, we see errors like this:
Thu Apr 03 19:29:16 PDT 2014 Thread[DRDAConnThread_338,5,derby.daemons] (XID = 6662), (SESSIONID = 0), (DATABASE = wombat), (DRDAID = null), Cleanup action starting
java.sql.SQLNonTransientConnectionException: Connection authentication failure occurred. Reason: Invalid authentication..

and:

Thu Apr 03 19:29:31 PDT 2014 : Execution failed because of a Distributed Protocol Error: DRDA_Proto_SYNTAXRM; CODPNT arg = 0; Error Code Value = 1. Plaintext connection attempt from an SSL enabled client?
org.apache.derby.impl.drda.DRDAProtocolException: Execution failed because of a Distributed Protocol Error: DRDA_Proto_SYNTAXRM; CODPNT arg = 0; Error Code Value = 1. Plaintext connection attempt from an SSL enabled client?
at org.apache.derby.impl.drda.DRDAConnThread.throwSyntaxrm(Unknown Source)
at org.apache.derby.impl.drda.DDMReader.readDssHeader(Unknown Source)
at org.apache.derby.impl.drda.DRDAConnThread.exchangeServerAttributes(Unknown Source)
at org.apache.derby.impl.drda.DRDAConnThread.sessionInitialState(Unknown Source)
at org.apache.derby.impl.drda.DRDAConnThread.run(Unknown Source)

But the timestamps are from more than 20 minutes earlier than the creation time of the error-stacktrace.out, so it is possible the derby.log file is unrelated.
Saw this again on trunk on Windows_amd64_jdk8: http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5594273/
…and on the new 10.11 branch on Windows_amd64_jdk9: http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5594261/
The attached patch d6336-more-info.diff changes the assert so that we get the full plan the next time it fails.

Commit 1616163 from Knut Anders Hatlen in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1616163 ]

DERBY-6336: Print more information when StalePlansTest fails

Commit 1616164 from Knut Anders Hatlen in branch 'code/branches/10.11'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1616164 ]

DERBY-6336: Print more information when StalePlansTest fails

Merged revision 1616163 from trunk.

Failed again with the extra diagnostics. http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5594417/javadb-task-3909544.html

The full plan looks like this (uses an index scan instead of the expected table scan):

					optimizer estimated cost: 1542.90

I ran the test with derby.storage.indexStats.log=true and saw that the index statistics daemon does kick in during the test. I don't know if that is what's causing this failure, but I think it makes sense to disable the index statistics daemon for this test. Since the test needs to control exactly when statements are recompiled in order to run reliably, it is imaginable that the index statistics daemon confuses the test if it kicks in and changes the index cardinality statistics at a bad time.
The attached patch d6336-disable-auto-stats.diff disables the automatic index statistics daemon in StalePlansTest.

Commit 1617439 from Knut Anders Hatlen in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1617439 ]

DERBY-6336: Disable index statistics daemon in StalePlansTest

Eliminate the daemon as potential source of instability.

The test failed on 10.8 codeline(revision 1629352)
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_8/windows/testlog/ibm17/1629352-suites.All_diff.txt
1) testStalePlansOnLargeTable(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.StalePlansTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError

FAILURES!!!
Tests run: 14529, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
